intro: Hymenophyllum polyanthos var. andinum, commonly known as the Andean haircap moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage with small, overlapping leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine, hair-like structures. This moss thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions of South America. Its leaves are usually green to reddish in color, and the plant lacks true stems and roots, relying instead on rhizoids for anchorage. Hymenophyllum polyanthos var. andinum plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitat.
